alert.note: Alert for Berks; Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 9:57PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of northern Berks, Lehigh, Carbon, Monroe and central Northampton Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 955 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty rain showers along a line extending from West Wyoming to near Delano to near Lickdale. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. Rain may mix with snow in the highest elevations of Monroe and Carbon Counties. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Lehighton, Mount Pocono, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Nazareth, Palmerton, Bangor, Kutztown, Jim Thorpe, Hamburg, Slatington, Fleetwood, Laureldale, Pen Argyl, Nesquehoning and Wind Gap. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 51 and 97. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 8, and between mile markers 10 and 60. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 278 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey near mile marker 0. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
